main event: On April 27, 1954, in Athens, Georgia, 13 unidentified flying objects were observed in a V formation, described as the size and color of grapes/fruit. The objects flew rapidly, climbed rapidly, and exhibited erratic flight patterns. The report concluded that it was an unidentified event.
interesting points: The objects were described as flying very fast, climbing rapidly, and exhibiting erratic flight patterns, including a zig-zag shape.
The sighting lasted for approximately 15 minutes, and the objects were observed to be under the clouds. The report mentioned that it was a very reliable report.
Observers on the ground, including an airman and a radio office operator, were described as reliable, dependable, and meticulous observers.

A senior pilot with approximately 4,000 hours of military flying time stated that any lights seen below the cloud level should have been easily heard, and that the sounds of jets are easily heard up to 30,000 to 40,000 feet altitude.
The Assistant Director of Scientific University of Georgia added that the observed trail seemed to disappear and reappear, emitting a 'haze' or 'mist' that couldn't be estimated.
sighted object: 13 unidentified flying objects in a V formation
witnesses: credible witnesses, including an airman, a radio office operator, a professor of Air Science and Tactics, and a 16-year-old witness
